review.body:
Thanks for this PR @MewenLeHo 

I can confirm the weird behavior in auto mode that switched between `data-bs-theme="dark"` (dark OS) and `data-bs-theme="auto"` (light OS). You fix allows to set the second use case to `data-bs-theme="light"` so that the behavior is consistent and allows to avoid handling "auto" in CSS.

@twbs/js-review, do you want to look at it too for a final review?

Note: when merged, we might want to:
- Inform users in the release note if they copied & pasted this file to update it
- Update our other repositories where a similar `color-modes.js` is used

pull_request.title: Fix edge case in color-mode.js
pull_request.body:
### Description

Our team found a potential edge case while working on our Bootstrap fork.

When using the current version of `color-mode.js`:

```js
  const setTheme = theme => {
    if (theme === 'auto' && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) {
      document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', 'dark')
    } else {
      document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', theme)
    }
  }
```

The results will be:

| `color-mode` on device | `color-mode` on Bootstrap | Result in HTML |
| :--------------------------: | :-----------------------: | :--------------: |
| `*` | `dark` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `*` | `light` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |
| `dark` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `light` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="auto"` |

At this point you may have an edge case when your device is set to 'Light mode' and you use the 'Auto color mode' on the page because you will have to add more CSS to make something like:

```css
@media (prefers-color-scheme: light) {
  [data-bs-theme="auto"] {
    // your code...
  }
}
```

Proposed patch:

```diff
  const setTheme = theme => {
- if (theme === 'auto' && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) {
-   document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', 'dark')
+ if (theme === 'auto') {
+   document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', (window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches ? 'dark' : 'light'))
  } else {
```

Then you will have:
| `color-mode` on device | `color-mode` on Bootstrap | Result in HTML |
| :--------------------------: | :-----------------------: | :--------------: |
| `*` | `dark` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `*` | `light` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |
| `dark` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `light` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |

And you don't need to add extra CSS everywhere.

### Motivation & Context

Fix edge case when your device is set to 'Light mode' and you use the 'Auto color mode' on the page.

### Type of changes

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [x] My code follows the code style of the project _(using `npm run lint`)_
- (na) My change introduces changes to the documentation
- (na) I have updated the documentation accordingly
- (na) I have added tests to cover my changes
- [x] All new and existing tests passed

#### Live previews

<!-- Please add direct links where your modifications can be seen in the documentation -->

- <https://deploy-preview-39224--twbs-bootstrap.netlify.app/>

pull_request.title: Fix edge case in color-mode.js
pull_request.body:
### Description

Our team found a potential edge case while working on our Bootstrap fork.

When using the current version of `color-mode.js`:

```js
  const setTheme = theme => {
    if (theme === 'auto' && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) {
      document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', 'dark')
    } else {
      document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', theme)
    }
  }
```

The results will be:

| `color-mode` on device | `color-mode` on Bootstrap | Result in HTML |
| :--------------------------: | :-----------------------: | :--------------: |
| `*` | `dark` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `*` | `light` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |
| `dark` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `light` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="auto"` |

At this point you may have an edge case when your device is set to 'Light mode' and you use the 'Auto color mode' on the page because you will have to add more CSS to make something like:

```css
@media (prefers-color-scheme: light) {
  [data-bs-theme="auto"] {
    // your code...
  }
}
```

Proposed patch:

```diff
  const setTheme = theme => {
- if (theme === 'auto' && window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches) {
-   document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', 'dark')
+ if (theme === 'auto') {
+   document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-bs-theme', (window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches ? 'dark' : 'light'))
  } else {
```

Then you will have:
| `color-mode` on device | `color-mode` on Bootstrap | Result in HTML |
| :--------------------------: | :-----------------------: | :--------------: |
| `*` | `dark` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `*` | `light` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |
| `dark` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="dark"` |
| `light` | `auto` | `data-bs-theme="light"` |

And you don't need to add extra CSS everywhere.

### Motivation & Context

Fix edge case when your device is set to 'Light mode' and you use the 'Auto color mode' on the page.

### Type of changes

issue.title: Searching for certain words in a bootstrap-table built-in "Search" does not work
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues - [X] I have [validated](https://html5.validator.nu/) any HTML to avoid common problems - [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) ### Describe the issue I have a bootstrap 5.x table that has "Search" enabled for it. The search works fine for states like "CA" or "CT" but not for states like "CO" or "UT". I am quite perplexed as to the reason for the difference in results. Bootstrap seems to be "building" the table based on the data, so it is challenging to troubleshoot, since some of the HTML does not exist until runtime. I could detect no meaningful difference between a search for "CT" vs "CO" (like some sort of corruption in the search, for example, or perhaps extra "spaces" like "CO" vs "CO ". Here is the HTML code at design time: ```
@*
*@
``` (Setting data-search="true" is what causes the Search input box to appear) Here is the resulting HTML and data at runtime: ```
Loading, please wait
State Code
Added States
AK
AL
AR
AZ
CA
CO
CT
DC
DE
FL
Showing 1 to 10 of 51 rows
102550100
rows per page
  • ‹
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5
  • 6
  • ›
``` Screenshot of a successful search for "CT": ![image](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/assets/26986675/c19b2b92-c8d9-4378-9762-b36c24f68979) Screenshot of an unsuccessful search for "CO": ![image](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/assets/26986675/932071f0-8283-4539-a28e-d266f69f276e) Some other details: OS: Windows 11 ![image](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/assets/26986675/68f17c77-6600-4eae-a97b-6b4afb1d48ad) Browser used: Chrome ![image](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/assets/26986675/2dd869fc-ee77-4069-b75f-a695ad83315f) Bootstrap: ``` ``` Current includes (ALL JS and CSS in the order they are included): ``` ``` ### Reduced test cases will provide ### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on? Windows ### What browser(s) are you seeing the problem on? Chrome ### What version of Bootstrap are you using? v5.3.2

comment.body: I posted in their repository.  Thank you for the link to it.

issue.title: Grid System should support CSS Container Queries for responsive column sizing
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

CSS Container Queries are becoming widely supported.
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Container_Queries
* https://caniuse.com/css-container-queries

Proposal: `_breakpoints.scss` should be extended to be configurable to use container queries, perhaps defaulting to the body or falling back to media queries where appropriate for backwards compatibility.


### Motivation and context

I have pages that can be displayed in either modal or full-page and currently there isn't a good way to wire up this sort of functionality.

Layouts with collapsible side navigation or modal dialogs would benefit from Container Queries instead of using normal Media Queries for responsive widths.

comment.body: +1 for that feature. E.g. creating cards or square-tiles holding lots of content (e.g. header, sub-header, text, buttons, ...) where the font-size should be scaled beside being rendered in 1-4 responsive columns depending on the parents width, is a huge mess just using breakpoints.

forkee.name: bootstrap
forkee.description: The most popular HTML, CSS, and JavaScript framework for developing responsive, mobile first projects on the web.

issue.title: Modal focus trap is not working the same way it does in documentation page
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed issues
- [X] I have [validated](https://html5.validator.nu/) any HTML to avoid common problems
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Describe the issue

If you open this page and launch the first modal, tab through it you should be able to stay inside that modal, meaning no other parts of the browser & page should be focused:

https://getbootstrap.com/docs/5.0/components/modal/

and this is working as expected. However, if you look into that StackOverflow question and a demo you will notice that after moving to the last focusable element the browser UI is selected:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72215340/bootstrap-modal-focus-trap-behaving-differently-on-bs-webpage

### Reduced test cases

https://jsbin.com/hutuhufuyi/edit?html,output

### What operating system(s) are you seeing the problem on?

macOS

### What browser(s) are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### What version of Bootstrap are you using?

v5.1.3

comment.body: My feedback as I just stumble into this, and it is quite frustrating. Seems that bootstrap focustrap can work only if modal is not the last focusable element in page. Focus behavior is OK on bootstrap documentation as there is plenty of buttons or links after each modal. Adding a `` at body's end on the provided broken examples made it work as expected. I think this focusable element outside modal allows to trigger bootstrap focustrap mechanism to bring back focus to modal. If there is no focusable element, then focus is passed to browser UI and bootstrap cannot override it.

issue.title: Form Control input type="search" 'x' (clear input) button
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have [searched](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate or closed feature requests
- [X] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Proposal

The browser's built-in 'x' (clear input) button on input `type="search"` (in light mode) is a blue color which doesn't quite match the look of Bootstrap - and likely many sites that use it. I suggest making a small CSS change to improve the look of it with this:

```css
input[type='search']::-webkit-search-cancel-button {
  filter: grayscale(1);
}
```

Demo:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/form-control-search-clear-gray-btn?file=index.html

### Motivation and context

This way it the clear input button will appear in gray which looks more like it's part of Bootstrap and I think a more neutral, natural color. In dark mode the close button would be unchanged (it appears in white both with and without the above CSS).

I've tested this in both Edge 118 and Chrome 118.
